space.arim.nameless.core

Class LiteNamelessCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.api.platform.PlatformRegistrable
      • space.arim.nameless.core.LiteNamelessCore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, LiteNameless, space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, space.arim.universal.util.AutoClosable

    public class LiteNamelessCore
extends space.arim.api.platform.PlatformRegistrable
implements LiteNameless
    Main LiteNameless implementation.

    reload() should be called after construction to load the plugin for the first time.
    Author:
    A248

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiteNamelessCore

        public LiteNamelessCore(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                        File folder,
                        space.arim.api.platform.PluginInformation information,
                        space.arim.universal.registry.Registry registry)
        Primary constructor, based on a logger, configuration folder, and Registry.

        For the plugin information, programmers may use:
        * BungeePlatform.get().convertPluginInfo(Plugin)
        * SpigotPlatform.get().convertPluginInfo(Plugin)
        * SpongePlatform.get().convertPluginInfo(PluginContainer)
        depending on the platform in question.
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger
        folder - the config folder
        information - the plugin information to use
        registry - the registry

        This is an alternative constructor used to maintain support for the JUL logging framework.
        Parameters:
        logger - a JUL logger
        folder - the config folder
        information - the plugin information to use
        registry - the registry

        public boolean enabled()
        Description copied from interface: LiteNameless
        Checks whether the plugin is enabled.

        The plugin is considered enabled if and only if:
        * enable-plugin is true in the config.yml * The host and api key specified in config.yml are valid
        Specified by:

      • updateGroup

        public void updateGroup(PlayerWrapper player)
        Description copied from interface: LiteNameless
        Detects a player's group and updates it on the Nameless website.

        The plugin automatically updates a player's group on login; however, programmers may require this method if a player's group changes while they are online. For example, a shop plugin, which updates a player's rank ingame, would also want to reload the user's group on the website.

        Process:
        1. The plugin scans the group IDs specified in config.yml.
        2. If the player has the permission corresponding to the group ID, the plugin will use that ID. If the player has multiple permissions corresponding to different group IDs, the plugin will use the last group ID in the configuration list.
        3. The plugin will update the user's group on the Nameless website.

        The procedure is done asynchronously blocking the main thread.
        In rare cases, (for example, if calling code is already asynchronous), LiteNameless.updateGroupSynchronous(PlayerWrapper) may be used.
        Specified by:
        updateGroup in interface LiteNameless
        Parameters:
        player - the wrapped player whose group will be updated

      • updateGroupSynchronous

        public void updateGroupSynchronous(PlayerWrapper player)
        Description copied from interface: LiteNameless
        Same as LiteNameless.updateGroup(PlayerWrapper) but conducts the operation synchronously.

        Most programmers will not need this method, unless calling code is already asynchronous.
        Care should always be taken to ensure IO operations do not run on the main thread
        Specified by:
        updateGroupSynchronous in interface LiteNameless
        Parameters:
        player - the wrapped player whose group will be updated
